doc.title: Burlington Stores (BURL.N)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-28/Burlington Stores BURL.N Sounding Like the MSD Comp Story of Old Sounding Like the MSD Comp Story of OldBurlington Store_2025-08-28

passages.text: Sounding Like the +MSD Comp Story old

BURL's 2Q results were a significant improvement vs 1Q and comps \((+5\%)\) and GM exceeded the market's high expectations. Mgmt demonstrated its ability to manage tariff headwinds and the tone was much more optimistic than the 1Q call. Mgmt spoke confidently about their work (BURL 2.0) paying off with strong results, though are guiding 2H very conservatively, particularly 3Q comp guidance of flat to \(+2\%\) despite an easier comparison (we model comps \(+4\%\) ). We understand the caution given the 3Q sensitivity to weather, but we note weather was unfavorable for them in 3Q24 (when they comped \(+1\%\) , creating an easier comparison). We continue to believe BURL and the off- price sector are likely to benefit from the disruption/uncertainty tariffs are causing, and that BURL has significant opportunity to close the operating margin gap with its off- price peers. After a flat comp in 1Q, they seem back to the +MSD of old.

Guidance: Raised F25 guidance: comps \(+1 - 2\%\) (vs prior guidance of flat to \(+2\%\) and vs FactSet consensus of \(+1.6\%\) ), EBIT margin \(+20 - 40\) bps to 7.1- 7.3% (vs prior guidance of flat to \(+30\) bps to 6.9- 7.2% and vs consensus of 7.3%), and EPS of \(\) 9.19- 9.59\(\) (vs prior guidance of 8.70 - 9.30 and vs consensus of\) \ \(9.26\) ). 3Q guidance of \(\) 1.50- 1.60\(\) (vs consensus of \(\) 1.67\(based on comps flat to \(+2\%\) (vs consensus of \(+2.6\%\) ). 4Q guidance of\) \ \(4.40 - 4.60\) (vs consensus of \(\) 4.63\(based on comps flat to \(+2\%\) .

Our ests and TP: We are raising our F25E from \(\) 9.02\(to\) \ \(9.73\) (vs guidance of \(\) 9.19- 9.59\(based on the 2Q beat as well as higher GM in 2H than previously forecast. We model F25 comps \(+2.7\%\) (vs guidance of \(0 - 2\%\) ) and operating margin \(+60\) bps to \(7.5\%\) (vs guidance of \(7.1 - 7.3\%\) ). We are raising our F26E from \(\) 10.61\(to\) \ \(11.33\) based on higher sales and margins than previously forecast. We are raising our TP from \(\) 340\(to\) \ \(358\) based on our increased estimates.

Incremental info from conference call and discussions with mgmt: (1) Mgmt indicated that 3Q was off to a "solid" start, but did not want to quantify as it is early in the quarter (LY at this time comps were \(+6\%\) , but then comps were down slightly in Sept/Oct) to finish \(+1\%\) in 3Q24. (2) Traffic was flattish in 3Q, hurt by a traffic decline (mgmt believes the weather had a significant impact on their traffic in May). Traffic was up in July. (3) AUR was up in 3Q, though driven by mix (lower mix of home product which is below avg AUR) and ongoing elevation strategy.

(4) Better sriw was the majority of the 60bps improvement in merch margin in 20 (and was the reason that merch margin came in above plan). Mgmt hasn't built in much benefi from shrink into guidance for 2H. (5) Mgmt continues to use many misi tion strategies to offset tariffs, including negotiating with vendors (which is u to the off-price business) and changing mix. Overall mgmt reduced 2H guidance by $0.10 to account for the incremental tariffs pressures from higher rates. (6) Stores with high Hispanic populations outperforming the chain (when excl the very strong performance of Puerto Rico stores and border stores which outperformed LY and are hurt by reduced border traffic). (7) The buying environment is currently strong, leading to a 43% YoY increase in reserve inventory in 2Q. Categories that were disrupted during the period of very high China tariffs (toys, cookware, decorative bedding) are back to near normal availability.

BURL is an off- price retailer operating \(\sim 600\) Burlington Stores locations across the U.S. as well as an ecommerce website. Stores offer in- season, fashion- focused merchandise, including women's, men's and kid's apparel (including men's tailored clothing), baby, footwear, accessories, home and coats. BURL sells a broad selection of relevant, first- quality, branded merchandise purchased from nationally recognized manufacturers and other suppliers at a discount to what they are offered at by department and specialty stores.

We rate shares of Burlington Stores Buy (1). We continue to believe that BURL and the off- price sector are well- positioned in the coming quarters and years (particularly as other retailers close stores, putting share up for grabs). BURL's execution has improved in recent quarters as mgmt implements initiatives and assortments improve.

Our DCF- based target price of \(\) 358\(is based on an 11% discount rate and a\) \sim 12x\(terminal EBITDA multiple. This TP represents an implied multiple of\) \sim 17x\$ our 2025E EBITDA, slightly below the multiples implied by our TPs for its off- price peers.

Risks to achieving our target price include: (1) inventory availability becomes less favorable than in prior years; (2) initiatives from the new CEO do not have the desired impact; (3) its large store size impedes the company from achieving productivity targets and it cannot reduce store size fast enough; and (4) store closures last longer than anticipated, resulting in greater sales declines.
If the impact on the company from any of these factors proves to be greater/less than we anticipate, the stock will likely have difficulty achieving our target price or could outperform it.

**Guide to Citi Research Fundamental Research Investment Ratings:**

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks.Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

**Investment Ratings:** Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "–" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management.Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.
**Catalyst Watch/Short Term Views ("STV") Ratings Disclosure:**

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near-term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over-ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer-term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings-distribution-disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution-disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share-price movement will not materialize as expected.
